sourcesContent:
import { useState } from "react" const Form = () => { const initialValues = { 'current-savings' : '10000', 'yearly-contribution' : '111', 'expected-return' : '7', duration : 2 } const [userInput, setUserInput] = useState(initialValues); const handleFormSubmit = (event) => { event.preventDefault(); console.log(userInput) } const handleInputChange = (name, value) => { setUserInput((prev) => { return { ...prev, [name] : value } }) } return (

handleInputChange('current-savings', event.target.value)} value={userInput['current-savings']} />

handleInputChange('yearly-contribution', event.target.value)} value={userInput['yearly-contribution']}/>

handleInputChange('expected-return', event.target.value)} value={userInput['expected-return']} />

handleInputChange('duration', event.target.value)} value={userInput['duration']}/>

) } export default Form;
